subject: Data
title: Replication: Copies for Safety and Speed
description: A quick, practical guide to Replication: Copies for Safety and Speed.

hook.text: Amazon's database crashes. If there's only one copy, millions of customers see an error page.

buildup.text: Database replication creates copies across multiple servers â€” if one fails, others take over instantly.

discovery.text: Read replicas serve queries from copies while the primary handles writes, multiplying read capacity.

twist.text: Replication lag means copies can be seconds behind. A user writes data, reads from a replica, and it's not there yet.

climax.text: Replication is essential for both reliability and performance.

punchline.text: Copies save you from disasters. Managing those copies IS the disaster.

quiz.question: What is a main purpose of database replication?
options: Creating copies for fault tolerance and faster reads
